sources.description:
Sunny Side Up (1929) 
Stars: Janet Gaynor, Charles Farrell, Marjorie White
Writers: Buddy G. DeSylva, Lew Brown, Ray Henderson
Director: David Butler

Silent screen sweethearts JANET GAYNOR and CHARLES FARRELL take the leap into talkies with this Romantic Musical at the dawn of Sound. Will LOVE take center stage‚Äîor will the music fade before their song is sung?

Step into the dazzling world of Pre-Code Hollywood with Sunny Side Up (1929), a landmark romantic musical that marked a pivotal transition from silent films to sound! Starring Academy Award-winner Janet Gaynor and the ever-charming Charles Farrell, this nostalgic gem features the beloved screen duo in one of their earliest talking pictures. Directed by David Butler and penned by legendary songwriting team Buddy G. DeSylva, Lew Brown, and Ray Henderson, the film delivers heartfelt romance, catchy musical numbers, and an irresistible slice of Jazz Age charm.

In Sunny Side Up, Janet Gaynor plays a lovable shop girl with big dreams, while Charles Farrell is a wealthy playboy searching for something real. As their paths cross, sparks fly‚Äîand so do the melodies. Co-starring the effervescent Marjorie White, this film is a must-see for fans of classic movie musicals, early sound cinema, and Hollywood‚Äôs golden era.

metadata.Plot: Molly and Bee, sweet young 'working girls,' live in a cheap room over a New York grocery store. Molly's idol, wealthy Jack Cromwell, lives in a Long Island mansion but is markedly less happy, since his fianc√©e Jane won't discourage her other admirers. Fleeing in his car, Jack ends up in an urban block party where he meets you-know-who.
